verses.text: 「便雅憫人哪！趕快逃命，離開耶路撒冷。你們要在提哥亞吹角，在伯．哈基琳升烽火；因為災禍和嚴重的毀滅，已從北方迫近。

words.note: Expresses exhortation or exclamation.
A verb-object compound meaning 'to escape for one's life'.
Often refers to sounding a shofar or trumpet for warning/assembly.
Lit. 'House of the Vineyard'.
A signal fire used in ancient times for warning.
Often used in prophetic warnings and judgments.
Implies an imminent, often threatening, approach.

verses.text: 美麗高貴的錫安居民（「居民」原文作「女子」），我必除滅你們。

words.note: Here meaning 'renders as' or 'is' in translation notes.
In biblical context, 'daughters' can metaphorically refer to the inhabitants or cities.
Expresses strong resolve or certainty.

verses.text: 牧人必帶著他們的羊群，來到錫安那裡，在城的四圍支搭帳棚，各在自己的地方分別牧放羊群。」

words.note: Indicates a continuous or sustained action.
Specifically used for setting up tents or temporary structures.
Refers to the act of pasturing livestock.

verses.text: 「你們要備戰攻擊她！起來！我們趁著正午上去。唉！可惜日漸西沉，暮影拖長了！

words.note: An interjection expressing regret or disappointment.
Describes the setting of the sun.
Indicates a change of state or completion of action.

verses.text: 起來！我們趁著夜間上去，毀壞她的堡壘。」
因為萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「砍下她的樹木，築壘攻打耶路撒冷；她是那該受懲罰的城，其中盡是欺壓的事。

words.note: Refers to the 'Lord of hosts'.
Classical Chinese particle, often equivalent to modern 的.
Refers to building siege works like an earthen ramp or wall.

verses.text: 井怎樣湧出水來，這城也怎樣湧出惡來；城中常常聽到強暴和毀滅的事，在我面前不斷有病患與創傷。

words.note: More formal or literary than 和.

verses.text: 耶路撒冷啊！應當受警戒，免得我的心與你疏遠，免得我使你荒涼，成為無人居住之地。」

words.note: Classical Chinese particle, often equivalent to modern 的.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華這樣說：「任憑他們像摘淨葡萄一樣對待以色列剩下的人；你要像摘葡萄的人，向枝子伸手，摘了又摘。」

words.note: Refers to the 'Lord of hosts'.
Classical Chinese particle, often equivalent to modern 的.
To completely strip or pick clean, like gleaning grapes.

verses.text: 我可以向誰說話，向誰警告，使他們可以聽從呢？他們的耳朵未受割禮，不能聽聞；看哪！他們以耶和華的話為羞辱，一點也不喜歡。

words.note: Refers to the religious rite of circumcision.
An exclamation used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Used in the structure 以...為... (yǐ...wéi...).
Used in the structure 以...為... (yǐ...wéi...).
Forms a negative phrase with 不, meaning 'not even a bit'.

verses.text: 因此，我心裡充滿耶和華的忿怒，無法容忍。「你要把我的忿怒向街上的孩童傾倒，又傾在聯群集結的年輕人身上。夫妻一起被捉住，年老的、壽高的也不例外。

words.note: Biblical name for God.
Often used for divine wrath in a biblical context.

verses.text: 他們的房屋、田地與妻子，都要一起轉歸別人；因為我要伸手，攻擊這地的居民。」這是耶和華的宣告。
「他們從最小的到最大的，個個都貪圖不義之財；從先知到祭司，全都行事詭詐。

words.note: Lit. 'unrighteous wealth'.
Lit. 'first to know'.
Carries a strong negative moral connotation.

verses.text: 他們草率地醫治我子民（「我子民」原文作「我子民的女子」）的損傷，說：『平安了！平安了！』其實沒有平安。」

words.note: Common term for God's chosen people.
In biblical context, often 'daughters' of a people.
A key concept in the Bible, equivalent to 'shalom'.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「他們行了可憎的事，本應覺得羞愧，可是他們一點羞愧都沒有，恬不知恥。因此他們必仆倒在倒下的人中間，我懲罰他們的時候，他們必倒下來。」

words.note: Often used for morally reprehensible acts in a biblical context.
An idiom meaning to be shameless.
Often used in biblical texts for falling in judgment.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：「你們要站在路上察看，尋訪遠古的路徑，看哪一條是美善的路，就走在其中；這樣，你們心裡就必得安息。他們卻說：『我們不走在其中。』

words.note: Commonly used in classical/religious texts.
Combines beauty and goodness.
Refers to spiritual and physical rest.

verses.text: 我設立守望的人照管你們，說：『你們要留心聽號角的聲音！』他們卻說：『我們不聽！』

words.note: Often refers to watchmen or spiritual watching.
Lit. 'keep heart/mind'.

verses.text: 列國啊！因此你們要聽。以色列會眾啊！要曉得他們將遭遇的。
大地啊，要聽！我必使災禍臨到這人民，這是他們的意圖帶來的結果；因為他們沒有留心聽我的話，我的律法他們也棄絕了。

words.note: Lit. 'keep heart/mind'.
Refers especially to God's law.

verses.text: 從示巴來的乳香，從遠地出的菖蒲，獻給我有甚麼益處呢？你們的燔祭不蒙悅納，你們的祭祀我不喜悅。」

words.note: Aromatic resin, often used in ancient rituals.
An aromatic reed, used in ancient perfumes and anointing oils.

verses.text: 因此，耶和華這樣說：「我要把絆腳石放在這人民的前面，他們父子一起在其上絆倒，鄰舍與朋友也都滅亡。」

words.note: Lit. 'trip-foot-stone'
Classical pronoun often found in biblical texts.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：「看哪！有一個民族從北方之地而來，有一大國被激動從地極來到。

words.note: Literary possessive particle, similar to 'de' 的.
Connects verb phrases, indicating sequence or consequence.

verses.text: 他們緊握弓和槍，性情殘忍，毫無憐憫；他們的聲音像海洋怒吼；錫安的居民（「居民」原文作「女子」）哪！他們騎著戰馬，在戰場上如同一人，列陣攻擊你們。」

words.note: Often used idiomatically to mean 'as one man' or 'united'.

verses.text: 我們聽到有關他們的消息，手就發軟；痛苦緊緊抓住我們，我們疼痛好像正在生產的婦人。
你們不要出到田野去，也不要在路上走，因為四圍有仇敵的刀劍和驚嚇。
我的同胞（「同胞」原文作「人民的女子」）啊！應當披上麻布，在灰塵中打滾，悲哀如喪獨生子，號咷痛哭，因為有行毀滅的會突然攻擊我們。

words.note: Lit. 'from the same womb', referring to people of the same nation.
A coarse cloth, often made of goat's hair, worn as a sign of mourning or repentance.

verses.text: 「我使你在我子民中作鑑辨和試驗的（按照《馬索拉文本》，「試驗的」作「高臺」; 現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯），好讓你查察、鑑別他們的行徑。」

words.note: Often seen in legal or scientific contexts for authentication or discernment.
The authoritative Hebrew and Aramaic text of the Tanakh (Hebrew Bible).
In biblical contexts, often refers to a fortified place or watchtower.
The earliest extant Greek translation of the Old Testament from the original Hebrew.

verses.text: 他們都是十分悖逆的人，到處搬弄是非。他們是銅是鐵，他們都是敗壞的。

words.note: An idiom meaning to spread rumors and stir up trouble.

verses.text: 風箱猛烈地吹，鉛在火中銷熔；他們煉而又煉，徒勞無功，因為邪惡的仍未除去。

words.note: A device for blowing air, used in smelting or for fires.
An idiom meaning that effort is expended without any result.

verses.text: 人要稱他們為被棄的銀渣，因為耶和華把他們棄絕了。

words.note: Refers to impurities that separate from metal during smelting.
